titles.en: THE BOOK OF BELIEF (Emān) AND DISBELIEF (KUFR)

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ الْعَلَاءِ بْنِ رَزِينٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّ الرَّجُلَ لَيَأْتِي بِأَيِّ بَادِرَةٍ فَيَكْفُرُ وَ إِنَّ الْحَسَدَ لَيَأْكُلُ الْإِيمَانَ كَمَا تَأْكُلُ النَّارُ الْحَطَبَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Al A’ala Bin Razeyn, from Muhammad Bin Muslim who said, ‘Abu Ja’farasws said: ‘The man comes to a sin hastily so he (gradually) disbelieves, but the envy consumes the Emān (so fast) just as the fire consumes the firewood’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ وَ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنِ النَّضْرِ بْنِ سُوَيْدٍ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ سُلَيْمَانَ عَنْ جَرَّاحٍ الْمَدَائِنِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ الْحَسَدَ يَأْكُلُ الْإِيمَانَ كَمَا تَأْكُلُ النَّارُ الْحَطَبَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: From him, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Khalid and Al Husayn Bin Saeed, from Al Nazar Bin Suweyd, from Al Qasim Bin Suleyman, from Jarrah al Madainy, (It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘The envy consumes the Emān just as the fire consumes the firewood’.

verses.text:
عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ دَاوُدَ الرَّقِّيِّ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَ لَا يَحْسُدْ بَعْضُكُمْ بَعْضاً إِنَّ عِيسَى ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ كَانَ مِنْ شَرَائِعِهِ السَّيْحُ فِي الْبِلَادِ فَخَرَجَ فِي بَعْضِ سَيْحِهِ وَ مَعَهُ رَجُلٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ قَصِيرٌ وَ كَانَ كَثِيرَ اللُّزُومِ لِعِيسَى ( عليه السلام )
فَلَمَّا انْتَهَى عِيسَى إِلَى الْبَحْرِ قَالَ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ بِصِحَّةِ يَقِينٍ مِنْهُ فَمَشَى عَلَى ظَهْرِ الْمَاءِ فَقَالَ الرَّجُلُ الْقَصِيرُ حِينَ نَظَرَ إِلَى عِيسَى ( عليه السلام ) جَازَهُ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ بِصِحَّةِ يَقِينٍ مِنْهُ فَمَشَى عَلَى الْمَاءِ وَ لَحِقَ بِعِيسَى ( عليه السلام ) فَدَخَلَهُ الْعُجْبُ بِنَفْسِهِ فَقَالَ هَذَا عِيسَى رُوحُ اللَّهِ يَمْشِي عَلَى الْمَاءِ وَ أَنَا أَمْشِي عَلَى الْمَاءِ فَمَا فَضْلُهُ عَلَيَّ 
قَالَ فَرُمِسَ فِي الْمَاءِ فَاسْتَغَاثَ بِعِيسَى فَتَنَاوَلَهُ مِنَ الْمَاءِ فَأَخْرَجَهُ ثُمَّ قَالَ لَهُ مَا قُلْتَ يَا قَصِيرُ قَالَ قُلْتُ هَذَا رُوحُ اللَّهِ يَمْشِي عَلَى الْمَاءِ وَ أَنَا أَمْشِي عَلَى الْمَاءِ فَدَخَلَنِي مِنْ ذَلِكَ عُجْبٌ فَقَالَ لَهُ عِيسَى لَقَدْ وَضَعْتَ نَفْسَكَ فِي غَيْرِ الْمَوْضِعِ الَّذِي وَضَعَكَ اللَّهُ فِيهِ فَمَقَتَكَ اللَّهُ عَلَى مَا قُلْتَ فَتُبْ إِلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مِمَّا قُلْتَ 
قَالَ فَتَابَ الرَّجُلُ وَ عَادَ إِلَى مَرْتَبَتِهِ الَّتِي وَضَعَهُ اللَّهُ فِيهَا فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَ لَا يَحْسُدَنَّ بَعْضُكُمْ بَعْضاً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Ibn Mahboub, from Dawood Al Raqqy who said, 
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Fear Allah<sup>azwj</sup> and some of you should not envy the others. From the Laws of Isa<sup>as</sup> Bin Maryam<sup>as</sup> was the travelling about in the city. So he<sup>as</sup> went out in one of his tours and with him<sup>as</sup> was a man from his<sup>as</sup> companions of a short stature, and he used to frequently accompany Isa<sup>as</sup>. 
So when Isa<sup>as</sup> ended up to the sea, he<sup>as</sup> said: ‘In the Name of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>’, with correct certainty from him<sup>as</sup>, and he<sup>as</sup> walked upon the back of the surface of the water. So the short man said when he looked at Isa<sup>as</sup> risking it, ‘In the Name of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>’ with correct certainty from him. So he walked upon the water and caught up with Isa<sup>as</sup>. Then self-conceitedness entered into himself, so he said (to himself), ‘This is Isa<sup>as</sup>, the Spirit of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, walking upon the water and I am walking upon the water. So what is his<sup>as</sup> merit over me?’ 
He<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘So he sunk into the water, and he cried for help to Isa<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup>. So he<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> grabbed him from the water and extracted him, then said to him: ‘What did you say, O Shortie!?’ He said, ‘I said, ‘This is Isa<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup>, Spirit of Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup>, walking upon the water, and I am walking upon the water’, and the self-conceitedness entered me due to that’. So Isa<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> said to him: ‘You had placed yourself in other than the place which Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> had Placed you in, therefore Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Detested you upon what you said. So repent to Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic from what you said’. 
He<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘So the man repented and returned to his status which Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> had Placed him in. Therefore, fear Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> and you should not envy each other’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنِ السَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) كَادَ الْفَقْرُ أَنْ يَكُونَ كُفْراً وَ كَادَ الْحَسَدُ أَنْ يَغْلِبَ الْقَدَرَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Al Nowfaly, from Al Sakuny, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> that ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The poverty can almost cause one to be a disbeliever, and the envy may almost overcome (disable) the power of an envying person’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ وَهْبٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) آفَةُ الدِّينِ الْحَسَدُ وَ الْعُجْبُ وَ الْفَخْرُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Muhammad Bin isa, from Yunus, from Muawiya Bin Wahab who said, 
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The disaster for the Religion is the envy, and the self-conceitedness, and the pride’.

verses.text: يُونُسُ عَنْ دَاوُدَ الرَّقِّيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) قَالَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لِمُوسَى بْنِ عِمْرَانَ ( عليه السلام ) يَا ابْنَ عِمْرَانَ لَا تَحْسُدَنَّ النَّاسَ عَلَى مَا آتَيْتُهُمْ مِنْ فَضْلِي وَ لَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيْنَيْكَ إِلَى ذَلِكَ وَ لَا تُتْبِعْهُ نَفْسَكَ فَإِنَّ الْحَاسِدَ سَاخِطٌ لِنِعَمِي صَادٌّ لِقَسْمِيَ الَّذِي قَسَمْتُ بَيْنَ عِبَادِي وَ مَنْ يَكُ كَذَلِكَ فَلَسْتُ مِنْهُ وَ لَيْسَ مِنِّي .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Yunus, from Dawood Al Raqqy, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Said to Musa<sup>as</sup> Bin Imran<sup>as</sup>: “O son<sup>as</sup> of Imran<sup>as</sup>! Neither should you envy the people upon what I<sup>azwj</sup> have Given them from My<sup>azwj</sup> Grace, nor should you<sup>as</sup> extend your<sup>as</sup> eyes towards that, and do not follow it yourself<sup>as</sup>, for the envying one gets angered at My<sup>azwj</sup> Bounties, blocks My<sup>azwj</sup> Apportionment which I<sup>azwj</sup> have Apportioned between My<sup>azwj</sup> servant. And the one who is such as that, so I<sup>azwj</sup> am not from him and he is not from Me<sup>azwj</sup>”’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْمِنْقَرِيِّ عَنِ الْفُضَيْلِ بْنِ عِيَاضٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ الْمُؤْمِنَ يَغْبِطُ وَ لَا يَحْسُدُ وَ الْمُنَافِقُ يَحْسُدُ وَ لَا يَغْبِطُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Al Qasim Bin Muhammad, from Al Minqary, from Al Fuzayl Bin Ayaaz, (It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘A Momin backbites but does not envy, and the hypocrite envies and does not backbite’.
